org.epics.graphene

Interface Point2DDataset


  • public interface Point2DDataset
    A dataset consisting of a set of 2D points.

    It represents a list of ordered tuples of two values, and their statistical information. The order may not be meaningful, but can be used to identify the points.

    Author:
    carcassi

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCount()
      The number of points in the dataset.
      org.epics.util.stats.Statistics getXStatistics()
      The statistical information of x values.
      org.epics.util.array.ListNumber getXValues()
      The x values of the point.
      org.epics.util.stats.Statistics getYStatistics()
      The statistical information of x values.
      org.epics.util.array.ListNumber getYValues()
      The y values of the point.

    • Method Detail

      • getXValues

        org.epics.util.array.ListNumber getXValues()
        The x values of the point.

        If the dataset is empty, it returns an empty list.

        Returns:
        the x values; never null

      • getYValues

        org.epics.util.array.ListNumber getYValues()
        The y values of the point.

        If the dataset is empty, it returns an empty list.

        Returns:
        the y values; never null

      • getXStatistics

        org.epics.util.stats.Statistics getXStatistics()
        The statistical information of x values.

        If the dataset is empty, or if it contains only NaN values, it returns null.

        Returns:
        x statistical information; null if no actual values in the dataset

      • getYStatistics

        org.epics.util.stats.Statistics getYStatistics()
        The statistical information of x values.

        If the dataset is empty, or if it contains only NaN values, it returns null.

        Returns:
        x statistical information; null if no actual values in the dataset

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        The number of points in the dataset.

        This number matches the size of the list returned by getXValues().

        Returns:
        the number of values in this dataset
